Summary During the past 8 years I have worked as an interaction / user experience designer (both freelance and employed) on different products and services, ranging from websites to applications. 
 
As an interaction designer / user experience designer my goal is to create human-computer interaction that 'actually works' and which creates new possibilities instead of new boundaries. Too often interfaces, computers and/or technology in general are too complicated to be actually useful. I believe a proper balance between graphical design, functional design and technical design will result in products and services that are transparent enough for the user to reach his goals and thus working towards a positive user experience, while keeping business goals in mind.  
 
Obviously this is only a condensed version of my vision, but if you agree with me and like to talk with me about this subject do not hesitate and drop me a line! Specialties:User experience design, Interaction design, User interface design, Prototyping, User testing and evaluation, Expert reviews Experience Sr. User Experience designer Google June 2011  – Present (4 years 3 months) I'm working as a UX design lead at Google where I'm designing the future of Gmail. User Experience Designer (freelance) Jeroen Jillissen August 2008  –  June 2011  (2 years 11 months) As a freelancer I assist large and small companies in pursuing great user experiences in order to create products and services that ‘work’. Activities range from concept and design to testing and implementation. 
 
Notable projects are ‘the VVE database’ (a study in simplifying the registration of ‘children with special needs’ for the municipality of The Hague) and the Interact Map (a tool to perform online marketing research for Millward Brown which has been used for research at companies like Kraft Foods and Coca-Cola). User Experience designer / Interaction designer Mexx International October 2004  –  August 2008  (3 years 11 months) At Mexx I worked on different types of projects, ranging from websites to applications, with a focus on creating compelling and user friendly experiences. Next to evangelising the user experience within the company, the main focus of my work was on conceptualising, prototyping and testing concepts/projects in order to create environments and experiences, which fit the brand and organisation.  
Being part of a small team and being the only user experience designer within the company I have worked a lot with external agencies and freelancers.  
 
Notable projects are the redesign of the Mexx E-shop and the Mexx B2B portal. Interaction Designer Scixed 2000  –  2004  (4 years) Started during our bachelor study Interaction design, Scixed was a small studio founded by Robert Grundeken and myself as an answer on all project offers we got during our study. Projects ranged from designing websites to building multimedia products.  Interaction Designer (internship) Datamex E-Sites January 2002  –  June 2002  (6 months) The focus of my internship was on redesigning the static Datamex E-sites CMS into a modular CMS, which could easily be adjusted to a specific site and would be better scalable. This redesign included changes to the structure, the technical side and interface.  Interaction Designer BFB Communications September 2000  –  December 2001  (1 year 4 months) Next to my study Interaction Design I was part-time employed at BFB Communications where I was co-responsible for the functional design, bridging the gap between technical development and graphic design.  
 
Notable projects are the realisation of the Microsoft Press webshop in co-operation with Microsoft Netherlands. Summary I'm Dezzie, User Experience Designer with a solid background in Graphic Design. I've been working at Google for nearly 8 years. For the last 6 years, I've been my own little Creative Studio within the People Development team: building brands, creating logos, collaterals and websites, designing interfaces, overseeing information architecture and defining the User Experience for Google's Learning tools.  
 
I find joy in solving problems in a creative way and creating interfaces that embody Google’s goal of one beautifully simple, intuitive user experience. Summary I enjoy creating easy-to-use, self-explanatory interfaces that users love to come back to. My experience in the user experience design field ranges across a wide spectrum of applications including enterprise software design, company websites and e-commerce and mobile apps which makes me qualified to creatively provide solutions for a broad range of needs. When I'm not working on UX-related things, you can probably find me mountain biking, listening to Neil Young or coming up with ideas for iPhone apps.

Thesis: Wanderlust is a mobile service tailored for creative people that use their identities and needs (in terms of time and distance) to allow them to immerse in new or unexplored spaces as well to meet people with similar interests. 
Wanderlust enhances community behaviours by providing suggestions from people and places that can be relevant to you (ad-hoc social networking) using a knowledge management model.

Wanderlust enhances community behaviours by providing suggestions from people and places that can be relevant to you (ad-hoc social networking) using a knowledge management model.

If I could describe the past few years in one word, I would say it was an evolution. Just like a Pokemon. I enjoy building beautiful products that connect people with one another. With a goal to make the world more open and connected, I'm working on simplifying productivity. 
 
"Dream big. Work hard. Stay humble."

Experience User Experience Design Intern Anthology Careers January 2015  –  May 2015  (5 months) Greater Seattle Area User Experience Design Intern Google June 2014  –  September 2014  (4 months) Mountain View, California I spent my summer at Google on the Social team. My projects consisted of designing new features within Google+ and Google Contacts. I was also able to contribute to other projects around the company. Product Design Intern Yabbly January 2014  –  May 2014  (5 months) Greater Seattle Area Yabbly's mission is to enhance how people share knowledge through conversations on our "ask me anything" social interviewing platform. Our company is backed by the former general counsel of Facebook, former CEO of Immunex, CPO of Acxiom, and current Google and Amazon execs. We've been featured in Fast Company, Mashable, NPR, Wall Street Journal, and were a finalist in the 2013 SxSW Startup Accelerator competition (top 18 of 550 startups competing, top 3 in the social category). 
 
Some products I worked on include Interview, Profile, and Communities. I also contributed to future, unreleased products by Yabbly. Co-Founder / Chief Design Officer Clustur May 2013  –  May 2014  (1 year 1 month) Clustur is a startup created by college students for college students. Our goal is to make event discovery on college campuses as easy as possible. As the lead designer I was able to design this app from the ground up and was in charge of every design decision. My role included interaction design, user research, designing simple user flows, creating mockups and wireframes, visual design, product feature brainstorming, and even the branding and identity of the company. Director of Marketing and Design Sacks of Love April 2012  –  May 2014  (2 years 2 months) Puyallup, Washington Sacks of Love is a Washington-based non-profit organization that aims to spread awareness for male health issues, specifically, testicular cancer. As a member on the Board of Directors I was able to revitalize the brand through careful and strategic design decisions through posters, a website, social media, and apparel. This led me to communicate effectively in a cross functional product development team and successfully promote and carry out design thinking throughout the brand. User Experience Design Intern Microsoft June 2013  –  September 2013  (4 months) Redmond, WA During the summer of 2013, I worked at Microsoft on the design team for Microsoft Office for Mac and iPhone. It was the first time I worked on a product that was used by billions of people. I really enjoyed this experience because I was able to really work closely on a team of designers, developers, and PMs. 
 
I had the opportunity to design and ship icons, layouts, and different iterations of future Microsoft Office renditions. I also recreated mockups, redesigned a website to have a better user experience, and designed different UI elements for Microsoft Office OneNote, Powerpoint, Word and Excel. Summary I am a senior product design leader with over 14 years experience in designing innovative user experiences across a diverse set of products, platforms, and industries for a wide variety of audiences. I view good design as successful problem solving, defining the right products & services to meet real needs delivered in a way that captures the heart of it's audience.  
 
I'm looking for opportunities in product design in which I can contribute a strategic vision, knowledge and experience to a positive, creative, and energetic environment with an emphasis on quality, and innovation. I have a wide range of experience across the full spectrum of UX design and I'm a firm believer in a holistic approach to design from user research, interaction design, visual design, to front end development, and product management. In addition, I am a certified scrum master and agile proponent with plenty of insights into how to align the design process.  
 
I am a visual problem solver with an innovative spirit and empathetic heart. Summary More than ten years of experience in all types of design, from print to interactive, for clients ranging from large Fortune 500 financial companies to promising start-ups in the social media space. Have a strong belief that aesthetics does not have to be sacrificed for good usability, but rather that the best results are achieved when the two are combined. Keep up with the latest industry advancements to stay at the forefront of this quickly evolving field. 
 
Experienced in designing social networks, & as an avid user of social media, have an excellent understanding of the latest trends & a passion for exploring its overall effect on society & human interaction. 
 
Keen interest & experience in mobile design (Android & iOS). Own a number of Android & iOS devices loaded with apps (waiting for my phone to explode). Always checking out how the best ones are designed and am an avid user of many myself. 
 
Familiarity and experience with Agile development 
 
Managing junior designers and working with engineers on pixel perfect implementation of designs 
 
Managing communications between clients & oversees development teams 
 
Working remotely with oversees development teams 
 
What I'd Really Like To Work On 
 
The projects that excite me the most are designing slick mobile and web apps, either from the ground up, or working on improving existing ones. I literally get lost in apps so find working on them extremely exciting. Not a must, but helpful, is if the app has a social aspect to it. By that I don't mean Snapchat, but something like a Sermo app that helps doctors around the world diagnose patients by easily connecting with each other and sharing anonymous patient data. I would also love to be involved in any project that deals with one of my many passions like music, movies / TV, sports, politics, science (especially space exploration), modern urban planning and services, etc. Basically anything that helps improve people's lives and has a positive impact on society. I would also love to be involved in any project that deals with one of my many passions like music, movies / TV, sports, politics, science (especially space exploration), modern urban planning and services, etc. Basically anything that helps improve people's lives and has a positive impact on society.
